name: Almond and Parsley Salsa Verde
author: Chef John
summary: The reason I'm calling this salsa verde and not pesto is because whenever you say pesto, people instantly think of the traditional version with the pine nuts and basil. I'm using the term salsa verde the way it's used around northern California. It's a very generic term for any fresh green sauce, usually starring some type of herb, but also can be made with spinach, arugula, etc.
ingredients: ⅔ cup roasted, salted almonds, finely chopped
directions: Combine chopped almonds and parsley on a cutting board; chop together again until very finely chopped
Transfer almond mixture to a bowl and add garlic
Stir olive oil into almond mixture until a thick sauce forms
